title: Quantum Hall states on the cylinder as unitary matrix Chern-Simons theory
abstract: We propose a unitary matrix Chern-Simons model representing fractional quantum Hall fluids of finite extent on the cylinder. A mapping between the states of the two systems is established. Standard properties of Laughlin theory, such as the quantization of the inverse filling fraction and of the quasiparticle number, are reproduced by the quantum mechanics of the matrix model. We also point out that this system is holographically described in terms of the one-dimensional Sutherland integrable particle system.
